Reviews.Title: “Superb Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really quite excellent. The room was modern and spotless with comfort that we needed. Actually we are also very chilled travellers, so it was quite relaxing for us to stay at Atlas hotel. The location is what everyone wants of a hotel in the heart of city being right next to the park is very peacefull. Definate on the high recommedation list.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicollain
Reviews.Content: The atlas hotel has pushed me into writing my first ever tripadvisor review. It is not clean, I had to ask for a shower head to be cleaned as I really could not have used it. The carpets are stained, the 'soap' provided was in a dispenser and 'for everything'. The service was hit and miss at best. I can't comment on the food as I could not eat there after seeing the room. It is also not a cheap rate hotel. Just don't bother, It could ruin your weekend away that you've really been looking forward too!!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: barry225
Reviews.Content: Looks great on their website, but as an 8-year regular IBC attendee this was a waste of money. Little more than a backpacker's hotel, but at business prices.Mean little room, sheets unchanged after 7 days, ragged towels, disinterested staff. Read the other reviews: there's a pattern.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, full facility rooms, small boutique hotel, great location, all perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mayfairlondon1010
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Amsterdam again and stayed with the family in Atlas hotel. It was turely great experience and relaxing stay in this small boutique hotel in the best location of Amsterdam. Rooms had all the facilities we were looking for. Will surely recommend this hotel to all and we for sure will be back again this year, hopefully before X'Mas.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of Amsterdam - Super Service”
Reviews.Author: CareTaak
Reviews.Content: What a perfect hotel loccted in the best area of Amsterdam. Turely great service by the staff and owner manager. They all went out of their way to service us and make our stay as comfortable as possible. We even got a complimentary breakfast though we had booked for room only. We were with 3 couples and each of us had very different rooms as the rooms were all decorated in a different way in the hotel. For all of us a definate must stay if you want to be in the best place in Amsterdam. We will be back soon after the this summer to enjoy Amsterdam and Atlas hotel once again.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! - the ridiculously RUDE staff will ruin your trip”
Reviews.Author: elushka2
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid traveler and an optimist so despite some of the bad reviews, I wanted to give it a chance. I have friends from all cultures and am very easy to get along with. I was in for the shock of my life at this hotel--- without exxageration----THE FRONT DESK STAFF (ESPECIALLY THE MANAGERS!!! AND "OWNERS" OF THE HOTEL) ARE SOME OF THE RUDEST PEOPLE I HAVE EVER EVER EVER MET IN MY LIFE. I was hung up on simply for calling to ask a question about the room. When I figured this was an accident and called back a second time I was told quote that "I'm an idiot, should know this" and how much they would like me "not be a guest" at "her" ("Ms. Meheta" a.k.a. "the owner of this hotel" ) anymore. I was beyond baffled , and have yet to this day been so insulted on any of my travels. I will NEVER go to this hotel---and I don't encourage anyone who has even the most basic manners and sense of respect to do so either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: leahrj
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Atlas. I was a bit worried because of reviews I had read and lack of interior bedroom pictures, but we decided to go for it because of the great price. It turned out wonderfully! It is situated in a beautiful, quiet spot in Amsterdam near the museum district. It is easily accessible by the #2 tram, Jacob Obrechtstraat stop. (Please note that the directions on the website leading you to the Valeriusplein stop are inaccurate, don't get off there unless you feel like doing some walking!) Our double room was on the small side, but that is to be expected in Amsterdam, and it was never uncomfortable. The room was kept very clean and we had a window with a lovely view outside and a good sized closet. The water was always hot and there was a coffeemaker included in the room (although we never used it). Also included was a hair dryer, other reviews said that you could use it at a charge, but that must have changed recently. Breakfast and wifi were not included, but I signed up for wifi access thru KPN for about â‚¬25 for a week. And as far as breakfast goes, there are plenty of cafes you can hit up for what it would cost at the hotel. We usually picked some things up at Albert Heijn and that worked out nice and cheap. I definitely recommend the hotel and would happily stay there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam6
Reviews.Content: No atmosphere from the minute you enter reception, My suggestion would be to play some nice music or light candles. Rooms were v old fashioned and poky. Communal toilet in hallway was similar to public toilet , needs a makeover. We were only served hot breakfast at weekend and were given cold breakfast during the week- not good enough ! Finally, we had to pay euros to store our luggage for 2 hours on day of checkout. I think this is a typical example of ripping off tourists! (even though we actually live in Amsterdam). On positive note, staff were friendly and nice quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel in the best area”
Reviews.Author: monellics
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Atlas hotel for 3 nights and payed about 200 euros (we got a special deal). The room we got was nice, it had three windows, but no balconies (which was a bit of an issue since my boyfriend needed somewhere to smoke). The room was very warm and cozy and perfect for hanging out after our long walks in the cold. It had a nice king size bed and a small sitting area. The decoration made the room look like more than 3 stars. The only issue for us was the bathroom door. The bathroom itself was quite nice-it even had a bathtub and everthing looked perfectly clean. But the door was the sliding type and it didn't exactly close-it just covered the opening. You could basically flap it open if you pushed it from the bottom. So with minimum coverage it was kind of uncomfortable using he bathroom-but we found ways around that (like turning on the TV). It wasn't that bad in the end. We didn't end up trying the breakfast, because we discovered a supermarket 5 minutes from the hotel, called Albert Heijn. It's a local branch. We found everthing we could possibly need for breakfast and lunch. It had sandwiches of all sorts and sizes, croissants, cinnamon rolls, cakes, bagels and all sorts of breads, pre-cut cheese and ham, pre-cut fruit and huge selection of juices. The hotel breakfast is 7.50 euros per person. We almost payed that much only on one day when we got way more than we managed to eat. So I would say try this grocery store!!! The hotel staff are helpful, and especially this one girl who speaks perfect american. She helped us get rid of the extra fee from paying with a credit card, she was very willing to help no matter what we needed (she even searched the internet to find us the type of restaurant we were looking for when she didn't know herself). She definitely makes a difference! I would recommend this hotel, but not for its full price-only if you get the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cemunal_stanbul
Reviews.Content: Being at a very good location close to the Amsterdam City Center, this hotel can be the best place to spend your holiday in Amsterdam. You go out and walk 50 meters to reach the Tram Stop. Then you can go anywhere. Leidseplain, the most attractive region in Amsterdam, is just a few stops far. And the museum district is just 10 minutes away by walking. The hotel is just fine. I mean it is not a place for luxury seeking guys. But it is clean, the personel is helpful and friendly. To mention about some negative points, the noisy sanitary system can be one negative point. But overall, this hotel is a nice place to spend your holiday in Amsterdam. But be sure to confirm your reservation you made from HRS or somewhere else, since you may be told that the breakfast is not included even though you chose the fee with breakfast included. Though the hotel personel was so friendly to accept our reservation and didn't charge any breakfast bill.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly fine”
Reviews.Author: euro13
Reviews.Content: I booked this months before our trip based on it's location-not directly in the city center but close-and its somewhat affordable price. Since my booking was inexplicably non-refundable, I began to panic as my trip grew closer and the reviews of this hotel seemed to get worse and worse. However, upon arriving late at night, I found the room to be clean and just fine, the weird orange color of the walls notwithstanding, the bathroom was acceptable, the shower water pressure was a bit tricky, but nothing that bothered me, the room was cleaned and made up daily, the desk staff were very helpful and friendly and the outer door locked at night so we felt safe, though it is in a very nice neighborhood right by vondelpark. I was shocked that internet was not 12 euros per day, but 17 euros for five hours which were consecutive, so we could not leave the room for five house once we activated the wireless. This was more than offset by the staff's willingness to let us do laundry in the hotel machines. I am certain that this is NOT a service they offer, but it was a great example of how hard the desk staff worked to keep the paying customers happy. Overall my time at the Atlas hotel was comfortable and comforting and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: mixpix
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on a long weekend break and was originally worried from reading some of the reviews. Any fears were unfounded though. The staff were friendly, welcoming and very helpful. The room was clean and modern and the hotel itself was in a quiet but convenient location right next to Vondel Park. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Any port in a Volcanic storm?! NO! NO! NO!”
Reviews.Author: HampshireSeasider
Reviews.Content: We had to move here for a night after a very pleasant stay at their sister hotel The King Hotel (see separate review) due to the air travel chaos that followed the Icelandic Volcano eruption. We had the last available room, otherwise I would not have accepted it. We were charged 151e for bed and hot buffet breakfast. The room was out of Fawlty Towers, please avoid room 104 at all costs!! It is situated on the ground floor with a view of a path. These are the basic complaints: * the electrics were dangerous, coming away from the wall with intermittent current!! * the bathroom (which was thankfully clean and ok) had a sliding door that had no bottom runner so could be pushed up like a cat flap and no lock! You also could not open this door if someone wanted to use the door going out of the room. * Doors seem to be a theme in this room, as the wardrobe could only be opened by pushing a finger into the keyhole, no handle! * The beds were twin beds as there was no way a double would have fitted. One bed had no light, the other no sidetable. The blankets looked quite grubby, thankfully the duvet and pillows were clean. Unfortunately the mattress was so lumpy that it was the worst night's sleep I have experienced in a hotel. * The carpet was badly stained. The decor dark and grubby. * This hotel boasts the facilities of tea and coffee making facilities but when we asked for a small jug of milk, were told at first that "we do not give away milk" before it was produced.A really nasty guy on duty in the evening but the morning employee was really helpful. It just goes to show how the staff can make or break your evaluation, but even the morning guy couldn't redeem the above "features"! * The hairdrier had to be collected from the reception for a 20e deposit. Quite what they thought we would have done with a 2 pin hairdrier in the UK I don't know. I just hate all the little charges such as storing your luggage for the day at 3e per suitcase. Maybe the nearby park bench would have been a better alternative after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the rooms need an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: Fiddie
Reviews.Content: After seeing a few reviews of this hotel in other guides, I thought that it might be worthwhile to stay for a couple of days. The hotel is in a wonderful location near to the museum district and is served by very frequent trams. However, the hotel itself isn't much to write home about. The rooms are small and the one we stayed in was decorated in bright orange which took a bit of getting used to. Luckily we were only in the room to sleep to it wasn't an issue. I can't really comment on the staff as we had no interaction with them at all other than checking in. There was no sign of internet in the rooms but I think you could get it in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: almost_genious
Reviews.Content: It's a perfectly acceptable hotel, and it's in a nice area. It's really close to public transportation. There's nothing overly special about it, but I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crevette007
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly for business in Amsterdam , and was suppose this time to stay over the week end with my boyfriend. As we are not big fans of corporate hotel or chains, I thought to look for a smaller nicer hotel not too far from the museum and center.... When I found the hotel Atlas I thought it would be perfect. It had good review on service quality and decoration from almost every guide... what a mistake not to have come and check Trip Advisor.... because frankly I found nothing posiitve about the hotel!!!!!!! My reservation was last minute, so I call on the day and reserved a double room for 6 nights. I sent an email with my american express card as guarantee. When I arrived after a day of work at 7pm in the hotel, the person at reception told me that Amex was not working and if I could use another card or go for cash... thing that I can not do... I had to insist until he called a manager who told him to enter the number of the card in the machine, as if not he did not want to give me a room... I must say that I must have known better has to pay in advance... but now with credit card it is mostly guarantee.... big mistake... Because on my second day I learned that will have to shorten my stay for personal family reason... I read the cancellation policy and was of course expecting to be paying one night cancellation fee (this is the policy if you do not cancel your room more than 3 days in advance). Then the first answer I was given was that 2 nights would be charge... I said that i found a little bit peculiar that they charge more if you are already here as if I would have been cancelling on my arrival day... Then they call a manager who said that nothing will be refunded as it was prepaid!!!!!! First of all this is not accordig to policy, and I will definitely block any charge to my credit card, but I think it is very tacky to try to rip off people... this probably because customer do not return!!!! Secondly when you think I reserved the day before you can imagine that I did not force them to turn down a lot of clients with my reservations so this is unacceptable and uncommercial... On top of this about the hotel itself.... The exterior is very nice and it is close to tram... but sincerly the room are very small and shabby... I would not have walked barefoot on the carpet...they try to make up for it with nice curtains and bed tops but it is still quite oppressive (my room was in the purples)... and please do not THAT YOU EVERYTHING YOUR NEIGHBOURS ARE DOING... so hope that you have quiet ones who do not wash TV, or speak..., and that your are not in a room near the floor door.... Last thing for the days when I was suppose togo in office, the breakfast that is noted to be serve aas from 7.30 is only served as from 8am... so i did not get anyway an apportunity to taste it! So my recommendation : do not go!! Sincerly it is not particularly cheap and you will find a lot more offer in these prices around so it is definitely not worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: damnomad
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here, after we were not able to extend our stay at the B&B down the street. In our 5 days in the area, at the B&B, we had grown to like the neighborhood, and started to feel like we were locals. There are a few great restaurants and bars within 3-4 blocks, that are much more local spots, than tourists. The staffs were friendly and quickly treated us as friends. So we didn't ant to move to a whole new are for the last few nights of our stay. We had passed the Atlas Hotel every day, using the entrance to Vondel Park that happens to be right next to the hotel. The park is the prettiest and quickest way to downtown. It's lovely to start and end your day walking or riding through the park. The hotel has bikes for rent, I suggest you take advantage of that. Amsterdam by bicycle is hoot, once you get the hang of it. Anyway, the Atlas was a nice place to stay. The frist room we got was on the bottom floor, with it's own outside patio (not really nice, but it's space outside), but there was a really loud humming noise, from we assumed some system in the building... We asked to move. We got a nice, small room upstairs, with windows looking partially into the park. It was a suitable room, but not big enough for me if I was gonna be there for more the 3 or so nights. For the same price we had been staying in a nicer B&B for the same price. But it seemed more reasonable than most other places we looked at. And, again it was in our neighborhood where we liked.

Reviews.Title: “basement room - not recommended..”
Reviews.Author: Mgetapint
Reviews.Content: stayed in Atlas Hotel in December. We got a room in a basement and we could hear people walking above. It smells like someone smoke weed there all the time. And hotel charged me extra 15 euro from my credit card after checkout without giving any invoice... I would not recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Next Time”
Reviews.Author: traveller_chica01
Reviews.Content: Close to a tram stop. Walkable distance to the Van Gogh Museum. Clean, comfortable rooms. Beautiful decorations. Very friendly staff. Bathroom was a bit small. Thanks for making my stay in Amsterdam memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rag714
Reviews.Content: Close to Museumplein, the Concergebouw, upscale shopping, good restaurants and a tram stop, this small hotel was the perfect location for our Amsterdam visit. The proximity of lovely Vondelpark was an added plus. The room was spotlessly clean, beds comfortable, and the service could not have been more friendly or helpful. Breakfast buffet included eggs and bacon along with the usual fruit, cereal, cold meats, cheese, yoghurts and pastries, and was sufficient to fuel us through most of the day. The hotel was recently purchased by the former owners of the Hotel Van De Kasteelen where we had stayed previously and which we loved. They are planning a renovation soon to freshen up the interior and we can't wait to return and see the results. The lighting in our room was not conducive to reading in bed and is one of the items that I am sure will be dealt with in the renovation. I heartily recommend the Hotel Atlas.

Reviews.Title: “clean, near tram, good bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: mel099
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, no fancy atrium, but near lots of attractions,and 3 tram lines; restaurants nearby, bars, too. smallish rooms (by american standards) but typical for europe cities.Clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Lu22
Reviews.Content: Altas hotel has a great location. A quiet part of of the city next to the Vondelpark and easy access to the city centre and attractions. A tram stop is very near by which makes it easy to get around the city. The hotel staff was very pleasant and were more than willing to help. The hotel is lovely and the room was nice and tidy but i did find that the bathroom was a bit outdated, cold and dimmly lit. Our room wasn't a huge room but it suited the two of us fine. We've paid less for better rooms in the pass but we did visit Amsterdam during a long weekend and the location was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable little hotel with great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: EliseWinchester
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Atlas and didn't experience any problems at the hotel. The staff was very helpful, we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go (we enjoy walking), and it was close to the trolly line if we decided not to walk. Our room was near the kitchen so it was a little loud in the mornings, but we took earplugs and were able to sleep through it. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, a bit off the beaten path, and a bit of charm”
Reviews.Author: Massimo1
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Atlas. It is a very solid 3 star hotel. The Atlas is not pretentious. It is quiet and personal. What the Atlas especially has going for it is the place itself and the location. It is a lovely converted mansion, I think, and it is literally a few meters walk from Vondelpark. Kind of a "wow" location in a very upscale residential neighborhood with charming early 20th century homes and apartment buildings around it. My room was top floor, in the front, so under a gabled roof, probably the former attic, so I had a bit of a view of the street. There are rooms down to the basement. My room was small, but that's Amsterdam for you. I have been to that city several times and smaller rooms are usually the case. It had a tight but complete bathroom with lots of hot water. The colors in the room tended to orange, but that's not a big deal. The room felt homey and it had a flat screen TV. The bed was supremely comfortable. I didn't try the breakfast, because there was a nice cafe-bar a minute away. I found the staff very helpful when I asked for transportation information. The girl on the desk pulled out maps, found schedules on the internet, and so forth. Quite a nice surprise. You think the Atlas is out of the way, but it is 50 meters from the #2 tram stop which takes you right into the center of Amsterdam in under 10 minutes, and it is no more than a 10 minute walk to the Van Gogh Museum (and another few to the Rijksmuseum. The only drawback in location is that trams stop around midnight so you need a taxi to get back late in the night. And the night rates start at a ridiculously high 7.50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keenhols
Reviews.Content: The atlas is agreat hotel ina lovely Area of Amsterdam. Location is amazing, close enough but still in a lovely neighbourhood. Easily reached to the Central Sation by tram and for the slighlty more keen by walking only about 15 minutes away and only 5 minutes by foot from the Leidseplan. 2 minutes from the van Gogh museum and the amazing shopping street rivalling New Bond street for top designers. The hotel itself is very quaint. Great staff, rooms are small but perfectly adequate and clean and comfortable. Great breakfast. Really cannot beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint. Excellent Location. Would return.”
Reviews.Author: JoanneTY
Reviews.Content: I too booked the Atlas Hotel after reading reviews on this invaluable website. We booked 2 double rooms from 8th - 10th December. Emailed the hotel in advance for directions from airport and received a prompt, informative response. Location is excellent. 10 minutes from Central Station by tram (no. 2) which stops literally less than 1 minute from the hotel. The hotel itself is quirky and quaint as I think has already been mentioned on this site. The lady on reception was lovely, she was only new but very nice and gave us maps and list of sights to see. The rooms themselves were spotless although extremely small, particularly the bathroom. A painting was clearly hanging off the wall in the bedroom, a very simple thing that could easily be sorted. Also the bathroom door didn't close properly. OK, so maybe I'm nit picking a little but 130Euro per night for a double room EXCLUDING breakfast is a bit steep for what we got. I know Amsterdam is a very populour destination but this is not city centre location and is only a 3* (if even that). In saying that, the Atlas Hotel really has something special, although I can't quite figure out what it is. I would definitely return again. Oh, beware of a 'tourist tax' whatever that is. â‚¬6.50 per person on our hotel bill "all tourists have to pay" apparently? Anyway, I didn't argue, I was too 'relaxed' to care :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: muyaq
Reviews.Content: I came to Amsterdam for a nice city break with my boyfriend. Having read other reviews i booked Atlas. On our arrival we were greated by a very helpful member of staff. Our room was big enough for the 2 of us, not huge but not small. The bathroom was very clean and had shampoo etc ready in waiting. The shower is great, lots of hot water and very powerful. Locations is great, its away from all the hustle and bustle but very easily assessable. Its is right near the Von Gogh Museum and Vondel Park. You can get trams 2 and 5 to the Van Gogh Museum and get off and walk, but the number 2 drops you right off outside the hotel, all you need to do is get off 1 stop after the Van Gogh Museum and its right across from the stop.

Reviews.Title: “Idea for a book”
Reviews.Author: Sfishface
Reviews.Content: We went to the Atlas as friends had booked in and like us were running in the Amsterdam Marathon/Half Marathon. We decided that we would write a book 'Quirky hotels we have stayed in' and start with this one. Hotel was ok, decor was a bit purple and more than a little like being trapped in a Mark Rothko canvas - a bit claustrophobic after a while. Hot water in the bathroom was VERY hot so be warned. Also having lugged my hairdryer all the way there, as the website said there was only one available at reception, I discovered one in the bathroom. Ho - hum. Also the owner's dog lives there, reasonably enough, but this combined with smoking was not entirely pleasant from my point of view. Smoking in confined spaces has only been prohibited in Britain since July 2007 - how quickly we adjust and become intolerant! At least I have. Upside is that the hotel is really handy for the trams (trusty old Number 2 tram will take you to Centraal Station and all points in between), some nice bars and restaurants. Don't miss the Cafe Luxembourg on Spui. Darlings, it is the only place to see and be seen, it has a non - smoking conservatory where the beautiful people sit. They always made me sit in the back - were they trying to tell me something?! Also any trip to Amsterdam would not be complete without a trip to the Rijksmuseum (2 stops on the Number 2) sadly still half closed for refurbishment and the Anne Frank Huis. This latter is a bargain at only E7.50, approx Â£5, ish, sorry there is no translation for those of you who work in $. Go out of the hotel, turn left and you will be in the Vondelpark in less than a minute. Feed the ducks, go for a run or just sit in one of the coffee shops and watch everyone else exercise!

Reviews.Title: “The Atlas was great!”
Reviews.Author: cajuncowgirl
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of Amsterdam hotels, we stayed at the Atlas in June, 2007 just before a cruise to Norway. This is in a three story early 1900's building which has a quaint curving staircase as well as a small elevator. While our room was small (slanted roof over the double bed), it was very adequate for our stay, and we did have a flat screen TV. The location was very convenient to the trams and the museums. The staff were very friendly and very helpful (for example, found a taxi to the dock and negotiated the price.) I thought this was a very good value, especially compared to prices at some of the other hotels. This is in a residential district, and the hotel was quiet. Vondel Park is nearby, it is huge and is a nice place during the day, but there was a young man who was probably on drugs who went around intimidating tourists (including us), so I would not go there in the evening. (You don't have to go there to get other places.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: jpatiodoors
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for five nights in late September. Wonderfully quiet and in a residential neighborhood near museums and Concertgebouw. Tram to Central Station to catch train to airport is less than one-half block away. Was quiet enough to sleep with a window open and a fan running for white noise. Room was small, but nicely decorated. Great flat screen TV, immaculate bathroom with tons of really hot water. Breakfast was great as well. At 9 Euros it's a deal. Staff was unfailingly helpful and polite. -Washington, D.C. visitor

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: blair1900
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in June '06. The room was an ok size but the bathroom was quite small. The bed was right below a sloping roof so banged my head a few times when sitting up. The room had a flatscreen tv in it. The hotel was in a great location , near the park although when we were there the entrrace closest to the hotel was blocked off for building purposes. the tram stop was right opposit the hotel which was excellent. The breakfast room was very small and cramped. We went for breakfast 1 morning - what a wrong decision - do not go for breakfast!! There was nothing there to eat!! What a waste of money, we basically had a cup of tea then had to go and get something elsewhere. The staff were friendly and the small lounge area was quite comfortable in front of the check in desk. Dont think i would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “VEry dutch”
Reviews.Author: Annie2006
Reviews.Content: Visited Amsterdam for 6 nights in May. Atlas was ideal for us (two couples). The trams are frequent and only one block away, but you can easily walk to most museum sights if you prefer. It was a pleasure to be in the quiet neighbor after a sigtseeing day. Plenty of local restaurants and pubs in easy walking. Property backs up to the huge city park as well. Rooms are smaller than in the US, but this is Europe you know. 24 hour desk/concierge were very helpful. Beds were comfortable and breakfast was good. Nice gated garden for an afternoon drink. Gives a good flavor of the locals. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: Etranger
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three-day visit to Amsterdam for the purpose of visiting the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum. The Atlas Hotel is ideally located for visiting these great art institutions as well as the Concertgebouw. It is also a minute walk from a tram stop, so you can easily get to Leidseplein, Dam, Central Station, etc. However, I had some reservations about the hotel itself. First, this is one of the few hotels I have ever stayed in where a hair dryer is not available. When I was having a shower, the water would suddenly turn ice cold. The bath room, though clean, had a faintly unpleasant smell. The coffee at breakfast was lukewarm. All relatively small things maybe, but it is those small things that make your stay at a hotel pleasant or not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a wonderful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jms-on-the-road
Reviews.Content: The Atlas is a small hotel just 50 meters from both the Vondelpark and from a tramline, so it is perfect as a base for an Amsterdam visit. Far enough away from the noisy all-night parties that you can get some sleep, but close enough that you can walk for 5 minutes and get whatever you want (or get on a tram and be in the center in 15 minutes). I stayed in Rm 313, at the top, overlooking the street. A very small room (I had reserved a "deluxe" room, but my guess is that didn't change what room I got) with two single beds and a small desk and TV, phone. Not luxurious, but for about 125 Euro not a bad deal in a capital city. The staff was friendly and helpful and everything was clean and tidy. My only issues were with the wireless Internet (didn't work, and really a trivial problem) and, much more importantly, no air conditioning. My room was at the top and during a few days of heat it was just unpleasantly warm. I would recommend this hotel for a budget-oriented traveler who wants a very good location and a problem-free stay, but not during the hottest of summer months. Otherwise, I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised, highly recommend this one!”
Reviews.Author: whisk666
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real treat. The desk staff was very friendly- the receptionist actually took us up to our room to settle us in. The presence of an elevator, although only large enough for 3 people max, was a real bonus in a city where it's uncommon to come across an elevator. We had a triple room and the beds were very. very comfortable. The room was clean and cozy with a lovely view. This hotel is a bit of a distance from the city center, but a tram runs right past the hotel and we did in fact walk from the city center on two occasions. This hotel had a real charming atmosphere and I look forward to staying with Atlas Hotel during my next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being my first time in Amsterdam, I insisted in staying at a hotel that is not a large chain to get a feel for the city. The hotel location is good, near the tram and Vondelpark, and museums. Since Amsterdam is easy accessible via tram, the hotel location is just fine. The rooms are very small, and you can hear everything that goes on in the hotel because of the thin walls. The hotel is also inexpensive, so I guess that I got what I paid for. The breakfast is completely Dutch - breads with cheese and meat, so be prepared if you aren't used to it. Next time in Amsterdam, I will choose a different hotel because the Atlas is nothing special, just decent.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose the Atlas because it was inexpensive and located outside of the main tourist area. When I had stayed at the Krasnapolsky I was kept awake by noise from the street and I didn't want that to happen again. The streets around the Atlas are indeed very quiet at night. However, since the walls and doors are paper-thin it doesn't matter. We heard every move the other guests made, the plumbing, etc. Thank goodness I had earplugs with me (and even then, I could hear doors slamming). Perhaps the rooms upstairs are better. Our double was quite small, the beds too hard, the pillows too big and it smelled of mold and mildew. I actually had an allergic reaction to the mold. There were also two spiders in the room when we arrived. However, the bathroom was very clean and there was plenty of hot water. The breakfast was large and tasty. Unfortunately, the staff sat right outside the little breakfast room, smoking and speaking (yelling, actually) so loudly that I should have brought my earplugs with me there as well. They also messed up on our bill. So, despite the pleasant but noisy staff and reasonable price, no I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Warm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the atlas during the Christmas Holidays. I chose the Atlas for it's location which is a couple blocks from the museums and close to everywhere by tram. The staff was courteous and capable and each day of my stay I felt more and more like staying there forever. They'll bring you a tosti wheneveryou need one. My room was a good size and the bed was comfortable. I'd defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ambience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located on Vondel Park near the museum plein is the lovely Atlas Hotel. Having spent a number of vacations in Amsterdam, with some stays as long as a month at a time I finally found the perfect hotel for both my wife and myself. The Atlas is clean, comfortable, and very freindly. The structure itself is charming, quiet, and well located. Above all the staff is first rate and adds just the right ambience to the Amsterdam vacation. I highly recommend the Atlas Hotel.
